p: Vitamin D (Vit D) is a fat-soluble vitamin that plays major role in calcium homeostasis. It is synthesized endogenously in the skin when exposed to Ultraviolet-B (UV-B) radiations in sunlight. 1,25-dihydroxy vitamin D [1,25-(OH) 2 D] is the active form of Vit D [ 7]. Our body’s innate and adaptive immune system provides protection against viral infections and aids in regulating cytokine levels in young and elderly populations, respectively. Vit D has been widely implicated in enhancing the immune response and suppressing the cytokine storm [ 8]. It’s deficiency has been linked to increased susceptibility to viral infections [ 9]. In this short review, we hypothesize that correlation exists between vitamin D levels and susceptibility to COVID-19, and Vit D supplementation could decrease the risk and severity of COVID-19.
